titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Duncan A. MacInnes papers, Rockefeller University Faculty FA178

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2018-11-02 00:36:44 -0400.

change.item: Paper finding aid converted to EAD/XML by AureXus in 2010. Imported into the Archivists’ Toolkit by Becky Robbins.

did.unittitle: Duncan A. MacInnes papers, Rockefeller University Faculty

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Duncan-Arthur MacInness, 1885-1965, scientist in physical chemistry worked at The Rockefeller University (earlier RIMR) from 1926 until his death in 1965.
He was the author of The Principles of Electrochemistry and numerous contributions to scientific publications and mountaineering magazines.

eventgrp.event: Born March 31, Salt Lake City, Utah
Ph. D. University of Illinois, Urbana
Instructor in physical chemistry, University of Illinois, Urbana
Associate in physical chemistry, University of Illinois, Urbana
Assistant professor, physical chemistry, MIT, Cambridge, Mass.
Associate professor in physical chemistry, MIT, Cambridge, Mass.
Associate Member, Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research, New York
William H. Nichols Medal, American Chemical Society
President's Certificate of Merit for War Researches
Edward Goodrich Acheson Medal of Electrochemical Society

bioghist.p: Member of: American Physical Society, Fellow, National Academy of Sciences, American Chemical Society, American Electrochemical Society (President 1935-1937), American Academy of Arts and Sciences, Harvey Society, American Philosophical Society

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes photographs, mss., reprints, journals; war contract Duncan, material.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: Arranged in chronological order within subject.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: MacInnes papers, along with the residue and remainder of his property both real and personal were bequeathed by will, unrestricted to The Rockefeller University.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted pending permission from Rockefeller University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes bibliography, personal correspondence, financial records, personal and family photographs, and will.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Autobiographical sketch including two additional holograph pages; account of laboratory researches 1926-1948; bibliography; Public Relations obituary; 2 page summary of biography written by Lewis G. Longsworth (written for RU exhibit, summer 1974 Burial certificate and note of interment).

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: Arranged in chronological order and personal.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes incomplete essay "Enjoying the Outdoors" (typed and holograph) correspondence from companions; American Alpine Club; Appalachian Mountain Club (including Conservation Committee); Representatives and Senators and Gov. Nelson Rockefeller.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: Arranged in alphabetical order by correspondent including incoming and outgoing letters. Number in parenthesis indicates number of items. If only one item present name not listed unless of special interest.

scopecontent.p: Includes abstract of "A redetermination of the Value of the Faraday with the Iodine Coulometer" and carbon copy of "Josiah Willard Gibbs and the Hall of Fame".

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 1952-1955 Recommendations on grants. 1957-1963 correspondence and budget dealing with NSF-C5093 and GP-1956.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence dealing with details of arrangements with participants, preparations and some final reports. After 1953 consist mostly of letters from chairman of particular conference clearing through Dr. MacInnes.

Conferences. In 1945 Dr. MacInnes, dissatisfied with results of conferences attended by large numbers, suggested to Dr. Jewett and Dr. Bronk that the National Academy of Sciences sponsor and support specialized 3-day conferences limited to no more than 25 participants actively at work in the particular subject area.
They were held primarily at Ram's Head Inn on Shelter Island and Arden House, though the first was held at The Rockefeller Institute.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Due to the nature and potentially brittle condition of the contents of the map collection, special arrangements may be required in order to view materials. Individual items may be restricted due to preservation concerns.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: In 1940 Dr. Vannevar Bush was authorized to form the National Defense Research Committee which in 1941 was absorbed by the Office of Scientific Research and Development. Under the direction of Dr. Bush, Dr. Conant of Harvard was in charge of the research done on chemistry and explosives. Problems were farmed out on contract to universities and other existing installations. Two such contracts, OEMsr-130 and OEMsr-350 were arranged with The Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research with Duncan MacInnes as the senior investigator. On the OEMsr-130 contract much of the laboratory work was under the supervision of Donald Belcher.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Mainly correspondence about work done in other installations and brief reports of work done at RIMR transmitted in letter form, primarily by Donald Belcher.
Includes memoranda on Edgewood Spray Tests (DuPont Co.) July/Aug. 1943.

did.unittitle: Travel. Vouchers and reimbursement records for travel on war contract

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence Edgewood Arsenal 1943 correspondence with Texas Oil Company.

did.unittitle: Report receipts including final, formal and monthly
War Department TM 1-282. "Tactics and Techniques of Air Chemical Spraying"
Correspondence in one chronological file dealing with budget, contract arrangements, personnel, property accounting, meetings and travel

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Office file of report receipts; final disposition including correspondence on declassification and photocopy of two declassified reports.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Including requests for deferment from army service and includes fingerprints.
